alert.note: Alert for Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 02 at 5:05AM EDT until July 02 at 7:15AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern New York, including the following county, Clinton. * WHEN...Until 715 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall resulting in the closure of multiple campgrounds. Multiple reports of washed out culverts have also been received. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 503 AM EDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mooers, Altona, Ellenburg Depot, Ellenburg, Irona, Miner Lake State Park, Mooers Forks and Sciota. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
